intro: Cymbalaria bakhtiarica, commonly known as the Persian heartleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. It is often found in regions with mild winters and warm, dry summers. Cymbalaria bakhtiarica is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
